OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: In the last years I worked at the Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences, University of Milan, Italy. I set up and I was responsible of the proteomics platform at the Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences, University of Milan, Italy, mainly dedicated to apply proteomics/biochemistry to protein carbonylation. Papers submitted or in preparation: Stegen S, Stegen B, Aldini G, Altomare A, Cannizzaro L, Orioli M, Gerlo S, Deldicque L, Ramaekers M, Hespel P, Derave W. Plasma carnosine, but not muscle carnosine, attenuates high-fat diet induced metabolic stress . (Submitted to Journal of Nutritional Biochemistry) Cannizzaro L, Rossoni G, Savi F, Orioli M, Carini M, Aldini G A high fructose diet induces protein glycoxidation and HNE protein modifications in rats which are attenuated by Rosiglitazone (manuscript in preparation) Proteomics characterization of bioactive molecules from colostrum with indications for the use in tissue repair, regeneration and for the substitution of stem cell therapies. (manuscript in preparation) I have an international experience: FDA (USA), Novartis (Singapore), University of Lausanne (Switzerland) and leading Universities or Research Institutes in Italy. I started with in vivo pharmacology on rats, biochemistry and protein engineering of industrial enzymes. Later I focused my efforts on biomarker identification and validation: immune-proteomics of cancer searching for tumor associated antigens on membrane proteins for their relevant therapeutic potential. I worked on post-translational modifications analysis of proteins. More recently I applied new proteomics approaches for cancer, tuberculosis biomarker discovery and I used SRM as validation for putative biomarkers.I worked in a specialized proteomics lab at the University of Lausanne,Switzerland. I had the opportunity to gain experience in several techniques such as the Proteominer and glycocapture. I also got familiar with (LTQ-Orbitrap) high resolution MS and data analysis.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Quantification of protein contaminants interacting with drugs in pharmaceutical preparation.
Peptide content determination of synthetic peptides.
Regeneration of nervous tissues study with the characterization of neurite extension at the molecular level in PC12 cells cultured on nanostructured TiOx in order to evaluate how the nanoscale topography may modulate the dynamic of adhesion and control the shape and functions of cells as well as of tissues. Protein patterns and post-translational modifications are evaluated by immunochemistry and mass-spectrometry.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Role of caveolae domains and caveolins protein in neuronal motility, using immortalized LHRH-expressing hypotalamic neurons as an experimental cell model. The research strategy involved various biochemical techniques and tools to study chemotaxis.
